intro: Ericoides genistifolium, commonly known as the slender broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its yellow flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to its natural habitat. The species is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand drought conditions.
